Machine Vision Camera SDK Developer Guide Linux (C) V4.3.0

Overview

This manual mainly introduces Machine Vision Camera SDK (MvCameraSDK), which provides multiple general APIs (compatiable with GigE Vision protocol, USB3 Vision protocol, Camera Link protocol, CoaXPress protocol, and XoFLink protocol, regardless of differences between device APIs), to implement the management of mutiple different frame grabbers and machine vision cameras.
The basic functions of MvCameraSDK consist of parameter configuration, image acquisition, image processing, and event function.
  • Parameter configuration: Supports getting/setting all parameters of device (e.g., width, height, and expose time).
  • Image acquisition: The SDK supports receiving images from the machine vision camera, and provides active search and callback modes for upper level softwares.
  • Image processing: Supports rendering image, converting format, saving image, recording, etc.
  • Event function: Supports device events and uploading exceptional statuses.

Contents

Update HistoryRecords the main updates of each SDK version.
Integrated Development Environment Introduces environment configuration of the SDK, including network configuration and driver installation.
Programming GuideIntroduces how to connect cameras and acquire images.
API Reference        Includes API reference of the SDK, and can be used together with the sample programs and programming guide.
Data StructureIntroduces the definition of structures in the API functions.
Camera Parameter Node Table Includes the commonly-used camera nodes. The parameters supported by the cameras are subject to those displayed in the MVS client.
Sample ProgramIntroduces the common samples and the basic operation guide of the APIs.
Error CodeIntroduces the definition of error codes returned by the API functions for debugging when an issue occurs.
FAQ Introduces debugging methods and frequently asked questions (FAQ).

Supported Operating System

        Linux 32-bit/64-bit:
  • Ubuntu 14.04 (32/64), Ubuntu 16.04 (32/64), Ubuntu 18.04 (32/64), Ubuntu 20.04 (32/64), Redhat7 (64), Centos7 (32/64), gcc/g++ version should be 4.8.5 or above.

Notice

  • The sample codes provided in this manual is only for reference. Improper sample code may fail to implement the expected function or even cause damage to the program. To ensure the normal operation of program, you should adjust the sample code according to your actual requirement and make a through test before using.
